metadata.title: CVE-2022-22721 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
If LimitXMLRequestBody is set to allow request bodies larger than 350MB(defaults to 1M) on 32 bit systems an integer overflow happens which latercauses out of bounds writes. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.52and earlier.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.17+esm5').
